From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin supplicāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [su.pliˈka]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [su.pliˈkaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Homophone: suplicà
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

suplicar (first-person singular present suplico, first-person singular preterite supliquí, past participle suplicat)

  1. (transitive) to beg; to supplicate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of suplicar (first conjugation, c-qu alternation)
infinitive suplicar
gerund suplicant
past participle masculine feminine
singular suplicat suplicada
plural suplicats suplicades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present suplico supliques suplica supliquem supliqueu supliquen
imperfect suplicava suplicaves suplicava suplicàvem suplicàveu suplicaven
future suplicaré suplicaràs suplicarà suplicarem suplicareu suplicaran
preterite supliquí suplicares suplicà suplicàrem suplicàreu suplicaren
conditional suplicaria suplicaries suplicaria suplicaríem suplicaríeu suplicarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present supliqui supliquis supliqui supliquem supliqueu supliquin
imperfect supliqués supliquessis supliqués supliquéssim supliquéssiu supliquessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — suplica supliqui supliquem supliqueu supliquin
negative (no) — no supliquis no supliqui no supliquem no supliqueu no supliquin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • súplica

Related terms

[edit]
  • suplici

Further reading

[edit]
  • “suplicar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “suplicar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “suplicar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “suplicar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin supplicāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

suplicar

  1. to beg; to supplicate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Lengadocian (Central Occitan)
simple compound
infinitive suplicar aver suplicat
gerund suplicant use gerund of aver + past participle
past participle suplicat —

first second third first second third

suplica supliquem suplicatz 1Now chiefly obsolete, still in use in some Limousin and Vivaro-Alpin dialects

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin supplicāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /su.pliˈka(ʁ)/ [su.pliˈka(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /su.pliˈka(ʁ)/ [su.pliˈka(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /su.pliˈka(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /su.pliˈka(ʁ)/ [su.pliˈka(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /su.pliˈka(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /su.pliˈkaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /su.pliˈkaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /su.pliˈka.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: su‧pli‧car

Verb

[edit]

suplicar (first-person singular present suplico, first-person singular preterite supliquei, past participle suplicado)

  1. to beg; to supplicate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of suplicar (c-qu alternation) (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / vocês)
Infinitive
Impersonal suplicar
Personal suplicar suplicares suplicar suplicarmos suplicardes suplicarem
Gerund
suplicando
Past participle
Masculine suplicado suplicados
Feminine suplicada suplicadas
Indicative
Present suplico suplicas suplica suplicamos suplicais suplicam
Imperfect suplicava suplicavas suplicava suplicávamos suplicáveis suplicavam
Preterite supliquei suplicaste suplicou suplicamos1, suplicámos2 suplicastes suplicaram
Pluperfect suplicara suplicaras suplicara suplicáramos suplicáreis suplicaram
Future suplicarei suplicarás suplicará suplicaremos suplicareis suplicarão
Conditional suplicaria suplicarias suplicaria suplicaríamos suplicaríeis suplicariam
Subjunctive
Present suplique supliques suplique supliquemos supliqueis supliquem
Imperfect suplicasse suplicasses suplicasse suplicássemos suplicásseis suplicassem
Future suplicar suplicares suplicar suplicarmos suplicardes suplicarem
Imperative
Affirmative suplica suplique supliquemos suplicai supliquem
Negative (não) não supliques não suplique não supliquemos não supliqueis não supliquem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • suplicatório
  • súplica

Related terms

[edit]
  • suplício

Further reading

[edit]
  • “suplicar” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913
  • “suplicar”, in Michaelis Dicionário Brasileiro da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), São Paulo: Editora Melhoramentos, 2015–2025
  • “suplicar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin supplicāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /supliˈkaɾ/ [su.pliˈkaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: su‧pli‧car

Verb

[edit]

suplicar (first-person singular present suplico, first-person singular preterite supliqué, past participle suplicado)

  1. to beg; to supplicate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of suplicar (c-qu alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive suplicar
gerund suplicando
past participle masculine feminine
singular suplicado suplicada
plural suplicados suplicadas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
indicative yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes
present suplico suplicastú
suplicásvos 		suplica suplicamos suplicáis suplican
imperfect suplicaba suplicabas suplicaba suplicábamos suplicabais suplicaban
preterite supliqué suplicaste suplicó suplicamos suplicasteis suplicaron
future suplicaré suplicarás suplicará suplicaremos suplicaréis suplicarán
conditional suplicaría suplicarías suplicaría suplicaríamos suplicaríais suplicarían
subjunctive yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes
present suplique supliquestú
supliquésvos2 		suplique supliquemos supliquéis supliquen
imperfect
(ra) 		suplicara suplicaras suplicara suplicáramos suplicarais suplicaran
imperfect
(se) 		suplicase suplicases suplicase suplicásemos suplicaseis suplicasen
future1 suplicare suplicares suplicare suplicáremos suplicareis suplicaren
imperative — tú
vos 		usted nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ustedes
affirmative suplicatú
suplicávos 		suplique supliquemos suplicad supliquen
negative no supliques no suplique no supliquemos no supliquéis no supliquen

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
